selected.context: Develops software solutions for the Financial, Healthcare, and Technology Industries
bullets: Technical leader in the project room producing lots of clean, solid code
Leading after-hours classes and study groups to mentor colleagues in Functional Programming
Exploring platforms off the beaten path, such as Elixir and Akka
Popular contributor to the company technical blog, for example: https://www.intelliware.com/typescript-a-good-part

selected.context: Offers data masking and de-identification products to the health industry, safeguarding Protected Health Information under HIPAA privacy law while preserving research value
bullets: Paired with brilliant scientists developing patented statistical algorithms
Implemented pipelines for data anonymization, generalization, and risk mitigation
Devised a synthetic-data generation strategy for functional and performance testing
Rebuilt source repositories and build pipelines to conquer process bottlenecks

selected.context: LG was consolidating PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) systems from four major divisions into a unified global system
bullets: Conceived and created low-level diagnostic tools that ultimately identified a single systemic flaw. It genuinely saved the multi-million-dollar project

selected.context: A trailblazing Software-as-a-Service organization focused on the packaging industry
bullets: Spearheaded the effort to evolve technologically, introducing (then) modern tools like Spring, JUnit, REST, and AJAX.
Collaborated with product management, customer representatives and development partners, producing web applications on the JVM

ancientTimes.synopsis: Additional developer roles at PrinterOn/Spicer Corporation, MatrixOne, Trek Bicycles, and OpenText are omitted for brevity
